recommendations.recommendation:
Very good Mystery/Suspense show. Definitely for fans of the `guess the traitor` gimmick, though the trope has been done better elsewhere. It being 12 episodes is a nice touch too, as too often these scenarios drag on and come to a dull conclusion.
Rokka has evidently disappointed a few people simply because they didn`t really read into to fine print of what the show actually was, expecting a by-the-numbers fantasy affair. If mindless sword-swinging and demon-slaying is your thing, you`d better look elsewhere, as this show is thoroughly about 7 characters trying to identify the traitor among themselves.

Rokka no Yuusha starts out as the typical heroic adventure, only to flip its premise on its head by turning into mystery thriller and it`s great. Like any good mystery, all the clues are there to figure it out, but it casts enough doubt on every possible culprit to keep up the suspense throughout its runtime.
The protagonist is what makes the show work though. Unlike most of the cast, he is neither particularly talented nor magically gifted. He has to fight using tricks, tactics and just generally using his brain, which makes it believable when he`s working through clues, trying to find the mole.
It`s very open-ended, though the major arcs are resolved, so don`t expect too much closure, but if you`re looking for a suspenseful, character-driven show, you won`t be disappointed.

I expected a fantasy series with slight difference. My expectation were fulfilled until the "who is traitor" session started, which turned out to go until the end. Still it was fun to watch, the action scenes have good quality and I adapted to the series. Some character are quite interesting, even though some lacked introduction and development. By introducing a new character shortly before the end, I can already see that a future season will not meet my original expectation either. Another season to play "who is traitor" again is boring. Epic fantasy fights and development of the relationship of the remaining warriors would be much more interesting to me in a future season. But I guess there won’t be a future season and if, it will be trash or repetitive.

I was skeptical first, I didn`t want another cliche fantasy anime, although I wouldn`t mind an original one even if it is dark fantasy. But this one is both fantasy and mystery at the same time. Can you discover the fake brave hero among the others like I did? :) Fighting scenes are good too.
A compelling detective story in the guise of a standard "defeat the evil demon lord" fantasy.

Don`t mind the avg rating of this anime coz there are shows that have an avg rating that don`t make any sense. Anyways, this show is, for me, a 9/10. This is a great, must see show. This is one of the very few interesting modern anime I`ve seen(show with moe chars). Especially, with the lacking 12 eps. The only downside I can think of right now is it`s too effing short & I can`t think of any more. This show doesn`t suffer from the usual shortening of the story that adapted anime suffer from. The event is well told and the pacing of the story is really good unlike the other short ep shows out there.
PREDICTABILITY ruins a show for me. Almost all shows give you hints to which way the story will go but this show wouldn`t give you any so it made me want to continue watching it and that`s a big plus for me.
Another downside I`ve thought of is the fleshing out of the characters and as I`ve thought and confirmed that it`s coz of the 12 ep limit that it`s weak by listening to the sp eps

I started watching this anime expecting a regular shounen/seinen with heroes going to defeat a demon lord and nothing more, but what I got was something else and suprised me in a good way. With the premise of a traitor being in the group, the whole series turns to a suspense and thriller anime. The fight scenes in this series are also a whole level better than most generic "adventure" animes

anime.description: * Based on light novel series written by http://anidb.net/cr8668 [Yamagata Ishio] with illustrations by http://anidb.net/cr43376 [Miyagi]. When the Majin awoke from the depths of darkness, the deity of fate chose six heroes and bequeathed them with the power to save the world. http://anidb.net/ch74974 [Adlet Maia], a boy who proclaims himself the strongest on Earth, has been selected among the Rokka no Yuusha (Heroes of the Six Flowers), and he goes to the rendezvous point — but seven have gathered there. The heroes suspect that someone among the seven is the enemy, and the initial suspicion falls on Adlet. Source: ANN

tag.name: detective
tag.description: A detective is an investigator, generally either a member of a law enforcement agency or as an individual working in the capacity of private investigators, tasked with solving crimes and other mysteries, such as disappearances, by examining and evaluating clues and records in order to solve the mystery; for a crime, this would mean uncovering the criminal`s identity and/or whereabouts. In some police systems, a detective position is achieved by passing a written test after a person completes the requirements for being a police officer; in others, detectives are college graduates who join directly from civilian life without first serving as uniformed officers. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: magic
tag.description: Magic is the art of purportedly manipulating aspects of reality either by supernatural means or through knowledge of unknown occult laws.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: swordplay
tag.description: The act or art of using a sword or similar weapon skillfully.

tag.name: fictional location
tag.description: A fictional location is a place or world which is run by different set of rules than our common and ordinary world. This may include completely fictional worlds with no semblance of Earth, computer-generated worlds, fantasy worlds, magical worlds, parallel worlds accessible through portals, and so on. Or it may be fictional places like floating islands, dungeons or planets, which can co-exist with ordinary Earth, but are otherwise separate from it. A world that generally shares the characteristics of, and/or is generally indistinguishable from the real world (bar research on a "more than cursory" level), would NOT be considered a fictional world. A good example is http://anidb.net/a4521 [Code Geass]. It contains several real world nationalities, such as http://anidb.net/a4521 [China], http://anidb.net/t2672 [Japan] (now Area 11), http://anidb.net/t5091 [India], etc, along with fictional nationalities such as http://anidb.net/t2361 [Britannia]. China, Japan, and India are easily identified with a cursory look. The location is unmistakably the planet Earth, even though national borders have been redrawn. The fictional world should only be tagged if it plays a materially important role in the plot and setting; generally, an episodic occurrence of a fictional world should not be tagged. A fantasy world is a type of fictional world, part of a fictional universe. Typical worlds involve, but are not limited to: magic or magical abilities, and/or a medieval theme. Some examples include: a parallel world tenuously connected to Earth via magical portals or items; a fictional Earth-like planet in the remote past or future; or an entirely independent world set in another universe. Many fantasy worlds draw heavily on real world history, geography, and sociology, and also on folklore.

tag.name: countryside
tag.description: The anime takes place far from the any densely populated areas like cities, i.e. out in the suburbs, in the countryside with many fields and forests.

tag.name: demon
tag.description: In Western lore, demons are often described as minions from Hell, generally known to attack humans and feast on their flesh or possess the bodies of those with weak souls. In Eastern lore, on the other hand, they are generally supernatural, often but not always malevolent beings who can be more mischievous than actually evil, or simply supernatural spirits of no specific alignment.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: fantasy
tag.description: Fantasy is a genre of fiction that uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting. Many works within the genre take place in fictional worlds where magic is common. Fantasy is generally distinguished from science fiction and horror by the expectation that it steers clear of (pseudo-)scientific and macabre themes, respectively, though there is a great deal of overlap between the three (which are subgenres of speculative fiction). In popular culture, the genre of fantasy is dominated by its medievalist form, especially since the worldwide success of The Lord of the Rings books by J. R. R. Tolkien. In its broadest sense however, fantasy comprises works by many writers, artists, filmmakers, and musicians, from ancient myths and legends to many recent works embraced by a wide audience today. Fantasy is a vibrant area of academic study in a number of disciplines (English, cultural studies, comparative literature, history, medieval studies). Work in this area ranges widely, from the structuralist theory of Tzvetan Todorov, which emphasizes the fantastic as a liminal space, to work on the connections (political, historical, literary) between medievalism and popular culture Source: Wiki

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: fictional language
tag.description: Fictional languages are intended to be the languages of a fictional world and are often designed with the intent of giving more depth and an appearance of plausibility to the fictional worlds with which they are associated, and to have their characters communicate in a fashion which is both alien and dislocated. Some of these languages, e.g. in worlds of fantasy fiction, alternative universes, Earth`s future, or alternate history, are presented as distorted versions or dialects of modern English or other natural language, while others are independently designed conlangs. A fictional language often has the least amount of grammar and vocabulary possible, and rarely extends beyond the absolutely necessary. At the same time, some others have developed languages in detail for their own sake, such as J. R. R. Tolkien`s Quenya and Sindarin and Star Trek`s Klingon language which exist as functioning, usable languages. Here "fictional" can be a misnomer.

tag.name: open-ended
tag.description: The ending of this anime is left to the viewer`s imagination. There are no clear hints at a definite story outcome, several possibilities are presented without closure, or the story ends suddenly without explanation. There may also be room for a sequel.

tag.name: plot twists
tag.description: The plot and story of this anime may seem to be going along a quite predictable path, when suddenly there is a jarring unexpected twist in the plot, taking the viewer by surprise.

tag.name: fate
tag.description: Fate — The predestined path of all things. The outcome is inevitable and the consequences predetermined. Whether or not the protagonist ultimately decides to follow this path shall weigh heavily on their soul.

tag.name: teamwork
tag.description: A cooperative effort by the members of a group or team to achieve a common goal.

tag.name: the chosen one!
tag.description: One of the characters in the anime is the "chosen one", the one to bring about change, the only one to "set things right" in a "good" ending, or bring about complete destruction in a "bad" ending.

tag.name: saving the world
tag.description: While villains love to take over the world or cause the end of the world as we know it, the heroes are most likely motivated by the polar opposite, saving the world. A fairly simple plot/motivation related to for great justice and what not, this trope is pretty broad and very common for many stories not focused on character interaction only. Source: TV Trope

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: ED variety
tag.description: Several ED sequences in this anime have either a different song or different animation, maybe even to the point of having a unique ED for each episode.

tag.name: CGI
tag.description: Computer-generated imagery (CGI) or computer animation is the art of creating moving images via the use of computers. It is a subfield of computer graphics and animation. Increasingly it is created by means of 3D computer graphics, though 2D computer graphics are still widely used for stylistic, low bandwidth, and faster real-time rendering needs. Sometimes the target of the animation is the computer itself, but sometimes the target is another medium, such as film.

tag.name: hard work and guts
tag.description: One of the character`s motto in the anime. Because there is nothing that cannot be achieved by hard work and guts.

tag.name: detailed landscapes
tag.description: An amazing view of nature, of artificially sculpted landscapes (i.e. gardens), or of a cityscape.

tag.name: sense of foreboding
tag.description: The anime starts off quietly, everything seems to be fine, but from episode to episode the signs that something ominous is about to happen increase. E.g. a typical mystery setting.

tag.name: betrayal
tag.description: Friends become enemies. Strong bonds of trust receive violations of confidence while friendships are faithlessly given up or revealed to have been false from the start.

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: back to square one
tag.description: The story returns to its starting point (or another situation) once or even multiple times. Possible causes for this might be amnesia or time travel. This sometimes leads to the repetition of certain events (like in the "Endless Eight" episodes in Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuutsu (2009)).

tag.name: rivalry
tag.description: Quite broadly used term describing a conflict, contest, struggle, or opposition of some sort. Typical examples: The mostly comedic rivalry for the love of a protagonist in a harem anime (love polygon), the more "mindless" battles between wannabe delinquents in a school fighting anime, or the struggle between good & evil in an epic conflict for world domination.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: 3D CG animation
tag.description: Abbreviation for "three-dimensional computer generated animation" or "computer graphics" (CGI). The traditional 2D art is enhanced by 3D imagery developed through computer modeling software. Done in the right way, this union of 3D in a 2D animated world can be a very beautiful relationship. The difference lies in what lacks the traditional 2D animation all together and may give term to something produced entirely with 3D graphics (such as the 2006 remake of "Appleseed" , 2007`s "Vexille", the 2008 addition to the "Biohazard" series and the more well known "Final Fantasy: The Spirits Within" and "Advent Children").

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Adlet Maia
character.description: Adlet is a reckless 18-year old who uses secret tools as a means of attacking, and describes himself to be the strongest man alive. In order to be chosen as one of the Six Braves, he enters (forcefully) into the consecrated martial arts tournament held in the Kingdom of Pienna, but is named the "cowardice warrior" from his fighting style. Source: Official Page

character.name: Goldov
character.description: Goldov is widely recognized as the strongest among all of the knights of the Piena "Kokkaku" Order. He basically stays silent and serious, but when in battle he manipulates his spear with his strong physique so skillfully. He faithfully pledges allegiance to Nachetanya. Source: Official Page

character.name: Chamot
character.description: Chamot is the saint of <Pond>. She tames an evil that lives in a pond in her stomach. Though she - now at the age of 14 - is a saint who is so-called "the world`s strongest" saint of all time, her personality is like a pure and naughty kid. Source: Official Page

character.name: Nachetanya
character.description: First heir to the throne of Piena, the kingdom which rules over the land. She appears to be very sweet, with her rabbit shaped helmet, but actually is a very skilled Saint of <Sword> who wins the martial arts tournament. Freewheeling and mischievous. Source: Official Page

character.name: Hans
character.description: Hans is a killer who talks like cat, and his swordplay is sharp, alert and agile. He always behaves in a playful ways and never looks tense, but he is quite coldly reliable when in battle. Source: Official Page

character.name: Flamie
character.description: Flamie is a white-haired, eye-patched, and expressionless mysterious girl. A Saint of <Explosives> with great battling abilities, who is adept with guns and bombs. She is a solitary individual who refuses to interact with anyone, and is determined to defeat the Evil God on her own. Source: Official Page

character.name: Maura
character.description: Maura is serving as a chief of the "Temple of Banten" which leads all the Saints. She is intelligent, well skilled and experienced in martial arts. She skillfully manipulates spirit and energy to the fullest as Saint of <Mountain>, and is an uncompromising fighter who has the power to easily crash rocks in pieces with the metal glove on her hand. Source: Official page

episode.title: 地上最強の男
The Strongest Man in the World
L`homme le plus fort du monde
Chijou Saikyou no Otoko
episode.summary: Piena, the largest nation on the continent, is having its annual ritual dance festival. The semi-finalists and winner are allowed to compete against the previous champion, Princess Nachetanya. One of the competitors is a daring boy, Adlet Meyer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 初めての旅
First Journey
Le premier voyage
Hajimete no Tabi
episode.summary: Adlet and the princess head for the Land where Demons Howl, past Gwenbyer, the Kingdom of Iron Hills. Ten days after they leave Piena, they meet villagers escaping from the fiends. Adlet suspects a trap, but challenges the fiends anyway! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勇者集結
The Heroes Gather
Rassemblement des héros
Yuusha Shuuketsu
episode.summary: The Braves head for the barrier temple, but they encounter a massive army of fiends along the way. To seal the fiends in, they`ll have to fight their way past. And to make matters worse, scores of flying fiends are bombing the temple! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 六花殺しの少女
The Girl Who Kills Braves
La tueuse de héros
Rokkagoroshi no Shoujo
episode.summary: The heroes, or most of them, meet up. Many of them want to kill Flamie, but she barely survives. Meanwhile, the king of Gwenbyer has come up with a plot to trap most of the monsters on the continent and make the way clear for the heroes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 凡人と天才
The Average Man and the Genius
Homme ordinaire et génie
Bonjin to Tensai
episode.summary: Adlet fights Hans, who finally realizes that he`s not the false brave. Chamot, however, is not so easily convinced. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人の理由
The Reasons of the Two
Leur raison
Futari no Riyuu
episode.summary: Adlet flees into the jungle to escape the other 6 braves. He talks with Flamie about her past. Is she the false brave? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 罠と潰走
A Trap and a Rout
Piège et débandade
Wana to Kaisou
episode.summary: With the others suspicious of him, Adlet must convince them that he is not a traitor. But to do that, he must discover how the temple was breached and the barrier activated. With the others have consolidated their suspicion of him, what will he do? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 七人目の勇者
The Seventh Brave
Le septième héros
Shichininme no Yuusha
episode.summary: The Six Braves have gathered, but the phantasmal barrier has been activated. With only one means of deactivating the barrier, the Braves must figure out which of them is the fake Brave. Meanwhile, Flamie reveals a surprising secret. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 解明の時
The Time to Reveal the Answer
Le temps des révélations
Kaimei no Toki
episode.summary: Having revealed "how" the seventh managed to trick the Braves, the only question left for Adlet to answer is, "Who is the seventh?" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 反攻
Counterattack
Contre-attaque
Hankou
episode.summary: Nachetanya decides that Adlet has betrayed her, and launches a full-on attack. Only Flamie can protect him from the combined might of the rest of the Braves. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 絶体絶命
Desperate Situation
Impasse
Zettaizetsumei
episode.summary: Maura tricks Nachetanya into going insane and trying to murder Adlet. Adlet declares his undying love for Flamie. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 疑惑の蕾
Blossoms of Doubt
Les germes du doute
Giwaku no Tsubomi
episode.summary: Chamot summons a horde of monsters to kill Adlet and Hans. Adlet comes up with an answer to the mystery, which Flamie shoots down. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナッシェタニアの謁見
Picture Drama 1
Nasshetania no Ekken
